page.title: 08THE LIFE OF A PEDIGREE EGG
page.content: My name is Engelbert.I am only a few hours old.I reside at a well known egg farm near Inchinnan.There are 5000 hens one of whom is my mother,but I was snatched away from her in the first seconds of my life.I am a pedigree egg who is not reluctant to rub shells with the lower grades of eggs. Sometimes I feel sorry for the farmer as he has to rise at 6.30am and he goes to bed about 9.30pm. Most eggs only live for a few weeks,and my time is nearly up. Some fruit is grown on the premises,including strawberries,but I have no contact with the fruit of the farm.There are also odd looking sheep. I think they are called Jacobs,from the Middle East.
